docs.snippet: Familiar scents like chai and black pepper are the basis of Bombay Perfumery’s eight eau de parfums.

headline.main: In India, Perfumes That Smell ‘Like Home’

docs.snippet: India's Ministry of Information and Broadcasting on Tuesday withdrew a sweeping new order clamping down on journalists accused of spreading fake news.

headline.print_headline: India Withdraws Sweeping New Rule Clamping Down on Fake News
headline.main: India Withdraws Sweeping New Rule Clamping Down on Fake News

docs.snippet: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has ordered the withdrawal of a move to crack down on journalists responsible for distributing fake news, a senior government official said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: India Withdraws Move to Crack Down on Journalists Publishing Fake News
headline.main: India Withdraws Move to Crack Down on Journalists Publishing Fake News

docs.snippet: ArcelorMittal SA, Vedanta Resources and a group comprising Russia's VTB and top Indian steelmaker JSW Steel have bid for bankrupt steelmaker Essar Steel India, the companies said, after a deadline for bids on Monday.

headline.print_headline: ArcelorMittal, Vedanta, VTB-JSW Partnership Among India Essar Steel Suitors
headline.main: ArcelorMittal, Vedanta, VTB-JSW Partnership Among India Essar Steel Suitors

docs.snippet: Violence erupted in several parts of northern and central India on Monday as thousands of dalits, members of Hinduism's lowest caste, protested an order from the country's top court that they say dilutes legal safeguards put in place for their mar...

headline.print_headline: Anger in India as Lowest Caste Protests Supreme Court Order
headline.main: Anger in India as Lowest Caste Protests Supreme Court Order

docs.snippet: A four-story rickety hotel building collapsed in central India, killing at least 10 people and injuring three, police said Sunday.

headline.print_headline: 4-Story Hotel Collapses in Central India, Killing 10
headline.main: 4-Story Hotel Collapses in Central India, Killing 10

docs.snippet: A special plane carrying the bodies of 38 Indian construction workers killed by the Islamic State group in Iraq arrived in the northern Indian city of Amritsar on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Bodies of 38 Indians Killed in Iraq Arrive Back in India
headline.main: Bodies of 38 Indians Killed in Iraq Arrive Back in India

docs.snippet: The Tibetan spiritual leader, the Dalai Lama, faces increasing isolation in his home in exile as India tones down an assertive stand toward its powerful neighbor and rival, China, in the hope of calming ties strained by a border stand-off.

headline.print_headline: Dalai Lama Faces Cold Shoulder as India Looks to Improve China Ties
headline.main: Dalai Lama Faces Cold Shoulder as India Looks to Improve China Ties

docs.snippet: Israel's national carrier filed a lawsuit against the government on Wednesday for allowing Air India to fly over Saudi airspace on its New Delhi-Tel Aviv flights, a move El Al says puts it at an unfair disadvantage.

headline.print_headline: Israel's El Al Sues Over Air India Flights in Saudi Skies
headline.main: Israel's El Al Sues Over Air India Flights in Saudi Skies

docs.snippet: Toyota Motor Corp will mutually supply cars in India with Suzuki Motor Corp starting in 2019, a move that would expand the Japanese company's foothold in emerging markets, the Nikkei reported on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Toyota, Suzuki to Supply Each Other Cars in India-Nikkei
headline.main: Toyota, Suzuki to Supply Each Other Cars in India-Nikkei
